Articles.Content: So, I've kinda abandoned ksp for a while and with it, the forums, the Main reason is called Civ 5 Brave new world. So, what are **your** 5 favorite games?

-Orbiter

-Minecraft

-SpaceEngine

\*looks at YouTube series\*

Currently:

1) FTL

2) Cities:Skylines

3) Invisible, Inc

Anything else wouldn't rank high enough to qualify as "favorite," though I'm enjoying Xcom well enough.

Damn... you gotta lay down the difficult question?

5- Legend of Zelda: Ocarina of Time

 - Incredible game for when it came out. Beautiful graphics, music, story... it's just a great game through and through. Original game price: 50-80$ for cartrige (N64) and 40$ (3DS remake)

4- Team Fortress 2

 - Fun fast paced online FPS with varying classes, weapons, gamemodes, and maps. Source engine, made by Valve, just fun to play. Price: Free to Play (with ingame purchases)

3- Legend of Zelda: Minish Cap

 - Fun game to sit down and play. Short game, fun and a real chill-out-game for bieing not so difficult, and is a hidden gem for the GBA. Price: 30-50$ (No remakes... yet.)

2- KSÃ¢â‚¬â€œ err... PokÃƒÂ©mon Emerald

 - First PokÃƒÂ©mon game I have ever played. Playing through it over a summer on an emulator was probably the best experience I have ever had. Most fun mobile game I have ever played. On my favorite console aswell. Price: 30-50$ (GBA) and 40-50$ (3DS remakes Omega Ruby and Alpha Sapphire, but I suggest original Emerald)

1- To the Moon

 - This game is shockingly deep, with a interactive yet linear storyline that will and has driven people (including me) to tears of both sadness and happiness. Thats all I'm gonna say about this game, because spoilers. 10$. Steam. Get it. Now.

5 - Spore. Despite the disappointment of the finished product, it was a fun game.

4 - Morrowind. Third game in the Elder Scrolls series. Had more than my share of fun moddimg that game.

3 - Mariokart DS. My friends and I had so much fun with that game.

2 - Skyrim. I have played this one for a little while. Lots of fun, modding is hard. But I'm learning.

1 - Emperor: Battle for Dune. Still my favorite game of all time. Ten years and I still haven't won. ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)

hmm.

5: turbo dismount - fun little game

4: Race07 - would probably be asseto corsa if I could afford it. ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif)

3: Minecraft - duh

2: Skyrim - duh again

1: Tekkit Lite/Tekkit Classic/Tekkit - huge modpacks for minecraft, all are fun, my favorite right now is tekkit lite. (78 mods in this pack. ![:0.0:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_shocked.gif) )

may i also mention that these are the only games i've really played

Other games I'm playing in no particular order

Twilight Struggle

Red Orchestra 2/ Rising Storm

Xenonauts

Steam Sale (It's a game where you try to find a sale, buy it, and then never play it)

Company of Heroes 2

Also final fantasy

4. Any Call of Duty (not counting Ghosts or 3)

3. BFBC2, BF3, and BF4 (same series so it counts)

2. L4D Series

1. Minecraft

I'm basically your stereotypical gamer.

Well according to steam:

2: Ultra Street Fighter IV - 807 hrs on record

3: Space Engineers - 482 hrs on record

4: The Elder Scrolls V: Skyrim - 241 hrs on record

5: Sid Meier's Civilization V - 168 hrs on record

6: Starbound - 159 hrs on record

I'm ignoring KSP which sits at the top of my steam most-played list. I should also mention Elite Dangerous, which has absorbed ~90 hours in the couple of weeks since buying it.

In terms of all-time favourites, it's hard to pin down, theres been an awful lot of them over the years.
Minecraft... specifically the Hypixel server.

Currently?

1. World of tanks Blitz (cuz its mobile ;3)

8. Diablo II (cause i played it badly when i was younger)

t. Metal Slug 2 & 3

$. Minecraft

5. Raptor - Call of the shadows (never gets old ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif) something to always keep installed)

My 5 favorite:

1. KSP (with lots of mods)

2. Minecraft

3. Superpower 2

4. KSP (without any mods)

5. Either Civilisation V or Civilisation: Beyond Earth

1. KSP (modded)

2. Unturned

3. NoLimits

4. Lego Racers 2

5. RCT3

and I think Minecraft is fun, but it's not one of my favorites because of its terrible community and horrible development.

Most recently;

1. War Thunder (I'm terrible at it, though)

2. Flight Simulator X (When all else fails.)

3. Mario Kart 8 (Who said that you can't play on consoles?)

4. Trimble/Google Sketchup (Yes, I have to admit, it's fun)

5. X-Plane 10 (For the eye candy)

Used to play Minecraft - Considering getting back to it. Just.. building by myself. That's all.
